original_title: Small irrigation tanks drying up fast due to dry spell
original_body_lines: COLOMBO (News 1st); Sri Lanka's Agrarian Development Department said that almost 1,000 small irrigation tanks or vewa's have dried up due to arid weather conditions.
It added that this situation had posed serious issues in sourcing water for various cultivation across several districts on the island.
Hundreds of acres of rice fields have been destroyed in the Kurunegala and Anuradhapura districts due to the dry spell.
It added that given the difficulties faced by local farmers, permission was granted to dig wells within the dried up irrigation tanks or vewa's.
The Agrarian Development Department said that limited monsoon rainfall and the dry spell had contributed to irrigation tanks drying up at rapid pace.
